content:
• Thursday, August 15, 2013

  • Asia trades lower after sell-off rocks U.S. shares

    • Asian stocks are lower across the board Friday, taking their cues from a nasty sell-off on Wall Street overnight.
    • Across the region: Nikkei -1.3%, Hang Seng -0.9%, ASX -0.9%, Shanghai Composite -0.6%, Kospi -0.44%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 PM
  • LRLCF

    L'Oreal makes offer for Chinese skincare company

    • L'Oreal (OTCPK:LRLCF, OTCPK:LRLCY) proposes to buy Magic Holdings, a China-based maker of cosmetic facial masks, for HK$6.5B ($845M).
    • L'Oreal says its offer is supported by Magic's board and that "six key shareholders, representing 62.3% of the company's equity, are already committed."
    • China is L'Oreal's third-largest market behind the U.S. and France.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • FMD

    More on First Marblehead earnings

    • First Marblehead (NYSE:FMD) FQ4 loss comes in greater than anticipated.
    • Revenues were $7.7M, lower than revenues of $8.9M in the prior year period.
    • The company also commented on the IRS audit currently underway, saying that it expects to receive Notice of Proposed Adjustment that would seek to disallow the loss that generated tax refunds previously received as well as require the company to include in its tax returns any taxable income of the Trust Residuals from the March 31, 2009 sale date through June 30, 2011.
    • The disallowance of the loss, coupled with the additional taxable income after the sale date, creates a proposed adjustment estimated to be approximately $300M plus interest.
    • Shares -28.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • UACL

    Universal Truckload Services announces public offering

    • Universal Truckload Services (NASDAQ:UACL) announces a 1M share public offering, of which 975K are being offered by a selling stockholder and 25K are being offered by the company.
    • The selling stockholder has also granted the underwriters an option to purchase up to 150K additional shares of common stock to cover overallotments.
    • The company will not receive any of the proceeds from shares being sold by the selling stockholder, and will use the net proceeds from its offering of common stock to pay associated offering expenses.
    • Shares -4.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • ATEA

    More on Astea earnings

    • Astea (OTC:ATEA) Q2 swings to a loss.
    • Net loss was $1M, compared to net income of $1M for the same period in 2012.
    • Software license revenues were $900K compared to $2.4M for the same period in 2012.
    • Service and maintenance revenues were $4.4M, compared to revenues of $5.7M in Q212.
    • Shares -6.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P dives thanks to Cisco, Aruba and Ruckus outperform

    • H-P (HPQ -4.5%) fell sharply today thanks to Cisco's (CSCO -7.1%) light guidance and order data, and perhaps also some of the specific factors that went into the numbers.
    • But shares are up 0.5% AH in response to Dell's revenue beat. The fellow IT giant reported a 5% Y/Y drop in PC division sales, and 8% growth in enterprise hardware sales.
    • Cisco, which fiercely competes with H-P in the server and Ethernet switch markets, mentioned on its CC enterprise orders fell 2% Y/Y in FQ4, thanks to a 10% EMEA drop. SMB (+5%), public sector (+6%), and carrier (+6%) orders were healthier.
    • Also, though Cisco's U.S. (+5%) and EMEA (+6%) orders were solid, Asia-Pac orders fell 3% Y/Y. H-P's Asia-Pac sales fell 12% Y/Y in the April quarter.
    • Cisco's data center revenue rose 43% Y/Y thanks to continued share gains for its UCS servers, but that represented a slowdown from FQ3's +77%. Switching revenue +5% Y/Y, thanks to 20% growth for the Nexus data center switch line. Routing was flat in spite of 69% growth for the ASR 9000 edge router line (good for EZCH).
    • Cisco Wi-Fi hardware rivals Aruba (ARUN -0.2%) and Ruckus (RKUS -0.4%) outperformed the Nasdaq. Cisco reported 32% Y/Y Wi-Fi hardware growth, a pickup from FQ3's +27%.
    • More on Cisco
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • AZPN

    Aspen Technology jumps AH on FQ4 beat and strong guidance

    • Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN) is up 11.6% AH on a strong FQ4 beat. Shares closed down 3.9% earlier today. This is the 8th straight quarter Aspen has beat consensus.
    • FY13 revenue grew 28% to $311.4M. Subscription & software revenue grew 44% in 2013 to $239.7M and 42% Y/Y in FQ4 to $65.2M. Services & other revenue fell 6% in 2013 to $71.7M and fell 1% Y/Y in FQ4 to $18M.
    • 2013 income from operations was $55.6M, compared to -$15M in 2012.
    • Management issued FQ1 guidance for EPS of $0.14-$0.16 on revenue of $83M-$86M (above consensus).
    • Aspen reiterated fiscal 2014 guidance for EPS of $0.60-$0.66 on revenue of $353M-$363M and upped FCF guidance to $160M (from $145M-$155M).
    • Management noted that certain financial metrics will not be an accurate reflection of the health of its business until it completes its transition to a subscription-based revenue model in FY15.
    • Conference call replay
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • APPS

    Mandalay Digital Group announces public offering

    • Mandalay Digital Group and its subsidiaries (MNDL) announce the launch of a public offering for an undisclosed amount.
    • The company intends to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including working capital and operations, and debt repayment.
    • Ladenburg Thalmann is acting as the sole book-runner
    • Shares -15% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • JOSB

    Jos. A. Bank -5% AH as earnings seen below Street expectations

    • Jos. A. Bank (NASDAQ:JOSB) -5% AH after saying it expects to see FQ2 earnings of $0.49-$0.53/share, lower than EPS of $0.83 in the year-ago quarter and below current Wall Street expectations for $0.68.
    • Although JOSB says its profit margin rate rose in June and July and Q2 will increase slightly Y/Y, "customers did not respond as well to some of our highly promotional, high sales volume marketing campaigns as they did in the prior year," with total sales dropping ~11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • LITB

    After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: LITB +13%. AZPN +12%. QIHU +8%. FRX +8%. TRLA +6%.
    • Top losers: EGO -7%. FSM -7%. AG -6%. RYL -6%. AEM -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 8 Comments
  • SFUN

    Soufun and YY slide as Nasdaq and Chinese stocks falter

    • Chinese tech darlings Soufun (SFUN -7.3%) and YY (YY -8%) slid sharply today. The Nasdaq's 1.7% drop and a broad selloff in Chinese stocks didn't help. Guggenheim's China Technology ETF (CQQQ -1.2%) and China Small-Cap ETF (HAO -2.2%) were also off on the day.
    • Soufun and YY ran up strongly after the real estate portal and social network's Q2 results blew past consensus and were accompanied by strong guidance . Other Chinese tech stocks took a breather today as well.
    • YY remains up 267% YTD. Soufun is up 192% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • PXLW

    Pixelworks falls AH on announcement of follow-on offering

    • Pixelworks (PXLW -6.6%) shares are down 2.6% AH following the company's announcement that it will issue a follow-on offering of common shares. The amount is not yet disclosed. (prospectus)
    • Previous: Rosy guidance sets off Pixelworks
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom earnings

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) Q2 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but missing on top line revenue estimates.
    • Net sales +6.4% Y/Y.
    • Total Company same-store sales increased 4.4%.
    • Same- store sales during the Anniversary Sale - historically is largest sales event - increased in the low single-digit range.
    • Sales trends showed moderate improvement relative to the first two months of the year but remained softer than anticipated.
    • The company cuts guidance for the full year, now seeing its EPS coming in at $3.60 to $3.70 per share, down from its prior outlook of $3.65 to $3.80. The Street is at $3.78 per share.
    • It also lowers overall sales guidance from previous expectations of between 4% - 6% to 3% - 4%.
    • Same-store sales expectations are also lowered to between 2% to 3% compared to its prior outlook of 3% to 5%.
    • Shares -2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • POWR

    PowerSecure to offer shares, stock drops

    • PowerSecure (NASDAQ:POWR)Â falls 4% AH following a 6.7% regular session drubbing.
    • The company says it intends to sell $44M worth of shares in a public offering (220K shares to be offered by CEO Sidney Hinton).
    • The proceeds of the offering will go towards "working capital, capital expenditures, acquisitions" and, ironically, share repurchases. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • ATEA

    Astea International EPS of -$0.29

    • Astea International (OTC:ATEA): Q2 EPS of -$0.29.
    • Revenue of $5.3M. Shares -12.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride falls double-digits

    • Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC) fell 11% Thursday on heavy volume.
    • Stephens downgraded the shares to Equal Weight from Overweight and cut the stock's price target to $20 from $23.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials misses by $0.01, misses on revenues

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $1.98B misses by $0.08B. Shares -2.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • JWN

    Nordstrom beats by $0.05, misses on revenues

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q2 EPS of $0.93 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $3.19B (+6.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.1B. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • HPTX

    Hyperion tumbles after S-3, Q2 revenues impress

    • Shares of Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX -9.8%) are under significant pressure.
    • The company filed a $150M mixed shelf yesterday (S-3).
    • Q2 results beat on the top line as sales of Ravicti came in at $6.2M (PR), well above Needham's estimate of $3.5M.
    • Needham's Alan Carr reiterates a Buy recommendation and raises the price target on the shares from $25 to $35 which, after today's losses, represents a nearly 55% gain. "We believe the stock is undervalued relative to other commercial stage companies in the rare disease space," Carr says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • FFHL

    Fuwei Films soars on news of controlling shareholder to sell stake

    • Shares of Fuwei Films (FFHL +188%) soar after the company said late Wednesday its controlling shareholder plans to sell its majority stake.
    • The Weifang State-owned Assets Operation Administration, plans to offer 6.91M shares, representing 52.9% of FFHL's float, in a public auction in China.
    • The indicative target price for the first auction is about $35.7M, or around $5.16 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • LWAY

    Lifeway sinks after Q2 report

    • Gains posted by shares of Lifeway Foods (LWAY -11.1%) following the company's Q1 report held up very well — until today. The stock is under quite a bit of pressure following Q2 results that came in light on the bottom line.
    • Gross margin came in at 33% for the quarter, down from 37% in Q2 2012 and 35% in Q1. The decrease is primarily attributable to a 20% increase in the cost of milk. Presumably, margins will eventually expand following the acquisition of Golden Guernsey dairy plant (which cost the company $300K in professional fees in Q2) as the money the company saves on processing costs provides a ~5-10% cushion against rising milk prices.
    • On this quarter's call, CFO Edward Smolyansky alludes to future cost savings, saying LWAY will "be able to utilize [new assets] ... to process milk and things like that." (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • BGG

    Briggs & Stratton slides on weak outlook

    • Briggs & Stratton (BGG -2.9%) slips today after beating Q2 expectations but guiding its FY14 to the low end of EPS estimates.
    • For FY14, it sees net income per share between $1.04 to $1.28.
    • Sales are seen between $1.88 billion to $2.03 billion.
    • The Street was targeting an FY14 EPS of $1.23 on sales of $1.95B.
    • Separately, Raymond James downgrades the shares from Outperform to Market Perform on the back of the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • MMLP

    Martin Midstream +11% after Alinda Capital acquisition, analyst upgrade

    • Martin Midstream Partners (MMLP +11.2%) surges after yesterday's news that infrastructure investment firm Alinda Capital agreed to acquire a 50% economic interest and 49% voting interest in the company's general partner.
    • Raymond James upgrades MMLP to Outperform from Market Perform on its expectations that cash flow could improve materially as the result of asset dropdowns, potential acquisitions and other opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • CCM

    Concord Medical Services rises as CEO, COO buy shares

    • Concord Medical Services (CCM +13.1%) soars midday after saying its CEO and COO have established a company which will purchase 4.66M ADSs (and quite a few common shares) for $6.10 per ADS. (13D)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • SLTM

    Voce Capital rails against Solta Medical in letter to its board

    • Solta Medical (SLTM -3.2%) slips after Voce Capital Management sends a letter to its board railing against recent moves by the company, including appointing Board Chairman Mark Sieczkarek as interim CEO.
    • Voce's letter also repeats its demand for an immediate sale of the company.
    • SA contributor StockMatusow predicts that Valeant (VRX) will acquire the company at a minimum acquisition price of $3.75 a share, or $300M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • RRGB

    Red Robin jumps as comps guidance is raised

    • Red Robin Gourmet Burgers (RRGB +8%) is sizzling following its Q2 top line beat.
    • Despite missing consensus estimates, revenues rose 6.5% Y/Y.
    • Company-owned comps growth came in at 4.3%.
    • Likely behind the stock's strong performance is management's projection for FY13 comparable restaurant sales growth of 3%. This is an improvement from previous guidance of 2.5-3%. Additionally, the company upped its guidance for restaurant-level operating margins from 20.9% to 21.3%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • BRK.A

    Buffett's new Suncor stake could be the start of something bigger

    • Warren Buffett's (BRK.A, BRK.B) new ~$524M stake in Suncor (SU +3%) is a declaration of support for controversial Canadian oil sands and could be the start of something bigger, perhaps plays in other Canadian oil sands projects, 24/7's Jon Ogg speculates.
    • The SU purchase will help ensure a steady supply of oil for Buffett's BNSF railroad to move; oil accounts for ~4% of BNSF's freight and is expected to double during the next several years.
    • SU doesn't have the same transportation issues as some other oil sands producers, a Morningstar analyst says; it has locked up more than enough pipeline and rail capacity to move its current and planed production for several years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 14 Comments
  • PHM

    Pulte to move headquarters to Atlanta suburbs

    • Pulte (PHM +3.7%) trades up today after announcing plans to relocate its corporate headquarters to the Buckhead community in Atlanta in 2014.
    • The homebuilder says it will have several hiring opportunities there, although it did not specify how large it planned to grow staff.
    • Separately, the stock was downgraded to Outperform from Top Pick at RBC Capital today, and its price target was cut from $26 to $20.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • CCCR-OLD

    China Commercial Credit posts huge gains following IPO

    • China Commercial Credit (CCCR-OLD +34%) — which provides direct loans and loan guarantee services to small- to medium- sized business in the city of Wujiang, Jiangsu Province of China — soars in its second day of trading.
    • The company priced its IPO at $6.50 and the shares began trading yesterday.
    • The two-day post-IPO rally now stands at ~156%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM

  • Precious metals and their miners fly higher

    • Maybe it's the dive in stocks or maybe word longtime bull John Paulson has turned seller, but gold is on the move, up to $1,361 per ounce - it's highest level since the start of the summer.
    • Silver is soaring and has also returned back to mid-June levels at $22.93.
    • GLD +2.1%, SLV +5%.
    • Related ETFs:Â GLD, IAU, SGOL, PHYS, AGOL, DGL, UBG, DGP, UGL, DZZ, GLL, DGZ, UGLD, DGLD, GLDI,Â SLV, SIVR, AGQ, DBS, USV, ZSL, USLV, DSLV, SLVO.
    • The miners have been moving higher for most of the summer and they're partying again, GDX +4.3% today, +35% from its late-June low. SIL +3.1% today, up 50% since late June.
    • Yesterday: Klarman's a buyer.
    • Related ETFs:Â GDXJ, GLDX, PSAU, NUGT, DUST, GGGG, RING, SLVP, SILJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 10 Comments
  • HIMX

    Himax falls on revenue miss, mixed guidance

    • Himax (HIMX -9%) expects Q3 revenue to fall 5%-12% Q/Q from Q2's $207M. That puts guidance easily below a $223.8M consensus. However, the company expects Q3 EPS of $0.102-$.117, above a $0.10 consensus.
    • Q3 large-panel driver sales are expected to be "sluggish" due to soft TV/laptop sales and the end of China's TV subsidy program.
    • Himax is also seeing small/medium-panel driver sales (growing quickly lately) soften due to inventory corrections and model transitions. Moreover, while the popularity of high-res displays is boosting Himax's high-end smartphone margins, the company is "seeing intense price competition" on the low-end.
    • Q2 gross margin was 24.6%, flat Q/Q and +150 bps Y/Y. GM is expected to rise slightly Q/Q in Q3 (a reason for the healthy EPS guidance).
    • Sales of display drivers for large-sized panels +7% Q/Q but -19% Y/Y to $64.3M. Driver sales for small/medium-sized panels +22% Q/Q and +32% Y/Y to $110.9M (strong smartphone, tablet, and auto demand).
    • Non-driver product sales (inc. image sensors, power management ICs, and the LCOS microdisplays Google is interested in) +30% Q/Q and +22% Y/Y to $31.8M. Himax says image sensor demand is growing.
    • Q2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • RSH

    RadioShack gains again on refinancing buzz

    • Shares of RadioShack (RSH +2.7%) poke out another gain, but still sit at a level below where they started the month.
    • There have been several different reports this week on potential refinancing deals the company is close to striking.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • WH-OLD

    WSP Holdings' buyout termination date extended

    • WSP Holdings (WH-OLD +32.9%) says the parties to the going private transaction of the company extended the buyout termination date to Dec. 31, and WH will file its annual report in September.
    • WSP recently delayed its annual and quarterly filings, and a negative article last week highlighting the risks of the deal cut nearly 40% off the share price.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • AVGO

    Brean cuts Avago to Hold on Cisco fears

    • Already worried about the impact Samsung's high-end smartphone weakness could have on Avago (AVGO -2.8%) Brean's Mike Burton is now also concerned about Cisco's "flattish" Oct. quarter guidance.
    • Burton also points out Cisco's "most bullish" CC remarks about service provider sales were related to switch and edge router products, rather than core routers (where Avago is more strongly exposed).
    • On a more encouraging note, Burton states Avago's "position at Apple an and the leading smartphones remains solid" thanks to its FBAR filter tech. Avago stated in May the technical demands of 4G phones are boosting sales of chips sporting its FBAR filters.
    • FQ3 results arrive on Aug. 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • IMOS

    ChipMOS rallies as market digests Q2 results

    • ChipMOS shares (IMOS -1.1%) were down as much as 8.5% in morning trading before rallying as the market digested its Q2 results.
    • A 23.3% Q/Q increase in gross profit outpaced revenue growth (11.7% Q/Q) on the back of "a favorable mix," partially offset by declining gold prices. (CC)
    • Q2 FCF was $13M after $25.7M in capex.
    • Overall utilization in Q2 was 79% (+4% from Q1). Testing segment utilization was 64% (+2%), assemblyÂ 79% (-2%), LCD driverÂ 88% (+13%), and bumpingÂ 87% (+4%).
    • ChipMOS expects sequential revenue growth of 2%-6% in Q3, gross margin of 16%-20%, opex of 6%-7% of revenues, D&A of $27M, and capex of $38M. The LCD driver and assembly businesses are expected to grow 5-8% and 14%-16% Q/Q respectively.
    • Full-year capex guidance was hiked to $128M ($100M previous). ChipMOS will pull "capex by about six months from 2014 in to the second half of 2013 ... due to the strong customer demand and end productive requirements" in the LCD driver market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday top 10 gainers / Losers

    • Midday top 10 gainers: FFHL +203%. BIOL +63%. VLTR +54%. WH-OLD +30%. AXX +15%. CCM +13%. SPEX +15%. NFEC +15%. AXDX +12%. VTNR +12%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: MTSL -16%. WHX -15%. KUTV -13%. LWAY -13%. RENN -12%. ZN -12%. TAOM -12%. SUMR -12%. STP -12%. DATE -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAXN

    Taser rallies again, shares up sharply this week

    • Shares of Taser (TASR +7.5%) rally hard for the second straight session, bringing gains to 16% since Monday's close.
    • Volume is already nearly 5 times the 10-day average.
    • The company had good things to say yesterday about the adoption of its on-officer cameras and related services.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • ONXX

    Onyx-Amgen deal likely despite rumored Kyprolis row: Deutsche

    • Count Deutsche's Robyn Karnauskas among those who aren't particularly concerned about the possibility of a rumored Kyprolis data dispute derailing buyout talks between Onyx (ONXX -6.9%) and Amgen (AMGN +1%). (previous)
    • "We think today’s reaction to the news is an over-reaction, and we still think an M&A deal between the two companies continues to look likely," Karnauskas says.
    • For his part, ISI's Mark Schoenebaum thinks AMGN "is using last week's disclosure about the interim analysis in FOCUS to pressure Onyx into accepting a lower price."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • EL

    Estee Lauder rallies despite below consensus guidance

    • After slipping briefly in the premarket following a slight earnings beat, in line revenue, and a below consensus FY14 profit outlook, shares of Estee Lauder (EL +4.7%) have found their footing.
    • Cramer had the following to say about the shares earlier today: "Sell to rich people, you do well."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • DANG

    Dangdang, Vipshop dive after earnings, Lightinthebox also lower

    • Dangdang (DANG -8.9%) and Vipshop (VIPS -9.6%) are both off sharply following their Q2 reports, and are taking fellow Chinese e-commerce firm LightInTheBox (LITB -8.1%) lower with them. A selloff in Asian equities could also be playing a role.
    • Vipshop beat Q2 estimates on the back of torrid Y/Y growth, but issued below-consensus Q3 guidance. Dangdang beat estimates and has guided for Q3 revenue of RMB1.58B ($259.2M), above a $253.3M consensus. But as with Vipshop, expectations were high following a huge 2013 rally.
    • One possible concern: Dangdang posted a gross margin of 17.1%, up from 13.1% a year ago but slightly below Q1's 17.2% in spite of 13% Q/Q rev. growth.
    • Q2 active customers totaled 7.6M, +3% Q/Q and +28% Y/Y. New customers amounted to 2.4M, flat Q/Q and +35% Y/Y. Total orders +25% Y/Y, up from Q1's +21%.
    • Books/media sales +22% Y/Y, marketplace GMV +178%, general merchandise sales again exceeded books/media sales.
    • Fulfillment spend fell to 12% of revenue from 13.8% in Q1 and 15% a year ago. Marketing spend rose to 5.1% of revenue vs. 3.2% in Q1 and 3% a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • TOL

    Homebuilders bounce as builder sentiment nears 8-year high

    • The NAHB builder sentiment index rises to nearly an 8-year high of 59 in August - the last time it was higher was 61 in November 2005. The move comes with the pace of new home sales nearing 500K annually, 38% higher than a year ago, but off from the 700K consistent with a healthy market.
    • The HomeBuilders ETF (XHB -0.4%) continues its summer decline, though it has bouncedÂ significantly since the NAHB print hit the tape.
    • Other ETFs:Â XHB, ITB, PKB.
    • A few stocks: Toll Brothers (TOL +2%), M/I Homes (MHO +3%), Hovnanian (HOV +1.7%), Pulte (PHM +2.2%), Lennar (LEN +3.1%), Ryland (RYL +1.3%), Beazer (BZH +2.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • IART

    Integra Lifesciences get FDA clearance for its Plainsboro New Jersey facility after inspection

    • Integra LifeSciences (IART +8.8%) pops after saying the FDA has finished an inspection of its regenerative medicine facility in Plainsboro, N.J. and found that the company has addressed issues raised in its warning letter.
    • The agency issued no other inspection-related observations on the facility, that was slapped with a warning letter in December 2011 relating to quality systems and compliance issues.
    • In April, the company also said it was voluntarily recalling certain products due to production concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • HH

    Hooper Holmes sells its Portamedic Brand for $8.4M

    • Hooper Holmes (HH +5.4%) says it's selling its Portamedic brand to American Para Professional Systems for $8.4M in cash.
    • The company said it expects its remaining product lines to generate around $50M in revenue in 2013, noting it has the potential to profitably grow revenues to $100M in the next four to six years.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • RASF

    Income stocks hit hard by rising yields

    • Anything paying income is again being particularly hard hit by the rise in Treasury yields (the 10-year now at a 2-year high of 2.8%).
    • Selections in mREITs (REM -2.1%), (MORT -1.9%) include RAIT Financial Trust (RAS -4.1%) - whose IRT had an ill-timed IPO yesterdayÂ and Ellington Residential (EARN -4.8%) - the market not caring about reasonable Q2 performance, a hefty discount to book, and the launch of a repurchase program. Other mREITs: CYS Investments (CYS -3.6%), Apollo (AMTG -3%), Newcastle (NCT -5%), Invesco (IVR -2.7%), Arlington Asset (AI -1.2%). A leveraged ETF play: MORL.
    • Hanging in there relatively well are the BDCs: Fifth Street (FSC -1.3%), Triangle (TCAP-OLD -1%), MCG (MCGC -1.2%), Hercules (HTGC -1.2%), Ares (ARCC -0.3%).
    • BDC ETFs:Â BDCS, BDCL, BIZD.
    • In emerging markets fixed income, a trader takes note of EDD, Â a closed-end fund now trading at more than a 15% discount to NAV.

  • FB

    Facebook working on PayPal rival; eBay shares slide

    • Facebook (FB +0.4%) confirms to AllThingsD it's testing an online payments product. A launch is expected in the next month or so.
    • Sources state the product, set to compete against 800-lb. gorilla PayPal (EBAY -2.4%), will "allow online shoppers to make purchases on mobile apps using their Facebook login information," and (like PayPal) will allow them to avoid having to constantly re-enter their billing info.
    • However, for now, the test is focused on simply "creating a better mobile checkout experience," and doesn't tie in payment-processing (as PayPal does).
    • Facebook already handles payments for in-app game purchases and its Gifts product (among other things), and the enormous reach of its social sharing tools could allow it to quickly reel in many 3rd-party apps and (if it chooses to expand further) Web sites.
    • But PayPal has stared down competition from Internet giants before, and the network effects stemming from its 132M active users and many thousands of merchant partners make it a tough company to seriously disrupt. PayPal expects to handle $20B in mobile transactions this year, up from $14B last year.
